intro: Tenagocharis latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved tenagocharis, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
